loadingScreen.rebind: You can Rebind the keys in the settings.
loadingScreen.loadingdone: 3D Canvas Ready! - Press to close this screen.

errors.initfailed: 3D Canvas: Initialization failed. This can be a caching issue, try CTRL+F5 to refresh the page. Make also sure you have an Active scene. Alternativelly 3D Canvas or one of it's dependencies might be out of date or corrupted. Make sure the modules are up to date and try a reinstall if everything else fails.
errors.gamecameradisabled: 3D Canvas: Disabling Game Camera - Game Camera is enabled but 'Use 3D Geometry for sight calculations' is disabled.
errors.filenotsupported: File format not supported or missing
errors.toofarfromdoor: Your Token is too far to open the door
errors.3dnotactive: Cannot open canvas popout, the 3D mode is not active.
errors.canping: User lacks permission to display pings on the map.
errors.canpingpan: User lacks permission to send camera position.
errors.overmaxelevation: The attempted movement exceeds the maximum elevation of this scene.

particleSystem.type: Particle system: type '%type%' not supported, the valid types are:
particleSystem.fromto: Particle system: Target and/or Source where not specified or are undefined.
particleSystem.onend: Particle system: .onEnd() - one or more arguments were not an instance of Particle3D.

errors.critical: 3D Canvas: A Fatal Error was encountered in the Rendering Loop. Attempting to recover...
errors.notarget: 3D Canvas: No target found for drag and drop. Please ensure you have at least one 3D Object or the Background Enabled.

clipNavigator.syncNotification: Level View for {{level}} Synced with all Players

mapgen.title: Map Generator - Cell height of 1 equals

generator.title: Generate Map
generator.content:
Are you sure you want to generate a new map? This will overwrite all the currently set elevations and cannot be undone!.
The first Material slot will be used as the ground material, the rest will be automatically mapped based on cell height.

sharemap.agreement: By sharing this map you aknowledge that you have the rights to share it and that you are not violating any terms of service of any of the used assets. You also agree that the map will be stored on the 3D Canvas server and that it can be removed at any time.
sharemap.imageinfo: Please upload a screenshot of the map on imgur and paste the link in the image field. If correct the image will show in the preview.
sharemap.title: Share Map
sharemap.name: Map Name
sharemap.author: Author
sharemap.secretinfo: Note that the key is not stored in an encrypted format, it's suggested to use the autogenerated random key, it will be automatically saved for future use in case you decide to resubmit a new version of the map.
sharemap.missingfields: 3D Canvas - Map Sharing | One or more fields are missing or no Asset Pack was selected
sharemap.gamemaster: Gamemaster is not an allowed author name.
sharemap.assetinfo: The shared map will not include custom assets. Please mainly use assets included in the allowed packs. Ctrl + Click to select multiple packs.

confirm.title: Map Sharing confirmation
confirm.content: Are you sure you want to share this map? Once shared you will not be able to edit the shared content.

success.title: Map Shared
success.content: The map has been shared successfully. The map is now available for everyone to enjoy, thanks for sharing!

sharing.error: Too many requests, please try again later.

dialog.title: 3D Canvas: Remove Core Keybindings
dialog.content: For 3D Canvas controls to not overlap core controls, it's higly suggested to remove the core WASD Keybindings. You will still be able to move Tokens or other Entities with Arrow Keys or NumPad. Do you want to remove them?

keybindings.lockcamera: Enable Camera Auto Mode (Game Camera Only)
keybindings.pingcamera: Ping and move Camera to Current view for all Clients
keybindings.ping: Ping current mouse position location for all Clients

maxElevation.label: Max Elevation
maxElevation.notes: Maximum allowed elevation for tokens on this scene.

isFog.label: Is Fog of War Box?
isFog.notes: Obscure view when camera enters this template. Works only for rectangle templates.

enablePlayers.label: Enable for Players
enablePlayers.notes: Allow players to open the 3D view for this scene, if the fog of war is not enabled, the map will be fully visible.

skybox.label: Skybox Image
skybox.notes: The file needs to be in the same folder of 6 total files, files must contain _ft, _bk, _up, _dn, _rt, _lf.

exr.label: HDRI
exr.notes: Supports .EXR files or images in a 360° panorama format. If no skybox is selected, the HDRI will be used as the background.

exposure.label: Exposure
exposure.notes: Exposure for the HDRI. 1 is the default, 2 is the brightest, and 0 is the darkest.

renderTable.label: Display Table
renderTable.notes: Render the table in the 3D view.

renderBackground.label: Display Background
renderBackground.notes: Display the background image of the scene as a board.

enableFogOfWar.label: Enable Fog of War (Performance Heavy)
enableFogOfWar.notes: Performance Heavy. This option will enable Fog of War in 3D, if 'Use 3D Geometry for Sight calculations' is enabled, Fog of War will be calculated based on 3D Geometry (it will still be two dimensional).

bakeLights.label: Pre-Bake Lights
bakeLights.notes: Pre-Bake the shadow casting of lights on scene load, they won't be dinamyc but they will not go through walls.

shadowBias.label: Shadow Bias
shadowBias.notes: Number that determines how shadows are rendered, if you notice black stripes on entities in the scene, you can adjust this number. Correct values for this number tend to be very small, it's suggested to make increments or decrements of 0.00001 or less.

initialview.label: Initial View Position
initialview.notes: Default camera position when the scene is loaded - before capturing the camera view set the target by using a ping.

enableGameCamera.label: Enable Game Camera
enableGameCamera.notes: Enable the game camera for this Scene. The Game Camera Must be Enabled globally in the 3D Canvas Settings for this to work.

color.label: Color
color.notes: Material and Color will work only on some models, usually the grey/untextured ones.

removeBase.label: Remove Base
removeBase.notes: Removes the original model's base, this will only work if the base is named 'base' in the 3D Model data.

rotationAxis.label: Rotation Axis
rotationAxis.notes: The axis to use when the original token rotation changes. If the original file was in STL format this will usually be Z, otherwise Y

rotateBase.label: Fix Base Rotation
rotateBase.notes: Some models require the selection indicator to be rotated, enable as necessary. (usually files converted from STL)

castShadow.label: Cast Shadow
castShadow.notes: Enable the shadow casting on the light - WARNING High performance impact!.

particlePreset.notes: The preset to use for the particle effects.

enableParticleHidden.label: Enable Particle Effect when the Light is Disabled.

header.title: Particle Effect
header.notes: The particle effect to use for the light.

rangeFinder.name: Range Finder
rangeFinder.hint: Show distance to tokens when hovering over them.

resolutionMultiplier.name: Resolution Multiplier
resolutionMultiplier.hint: WARNING: Changing this setting will also affect the resolution of the 2D View. Requires Refresh.

fogDebounce.name: Fog of War Update Throttling
fogDebounce.hint: If Disabled vision and Fog of War will be constantly refreshed.

sharedContext.name: Shared Context
sharedContext.hint: If Enabled, Fog of War performance will be drastically improved but you will not be able to use the Mini Canvas.

preapplyShaders.name: Pre-Load Shaders
preapplyShaders.hint: If Enabled, the shaders will be applied before the render loop starts. This will prevent stutters when activating shaders for the first time, but might cause a minor impact on performance and/or load times.

showAdvanced.name: Always Show Advanced Settings
showAdvanced.hint: Show the advanced settings in configuration menus by default.

navigatorAuto.name: Navigator Follow Mode
navigatorAuto.hint: Automatically enables the Follow Mode for the 3D Navigator on scene load.

basics.title: Basics
basics.notes: Configure basic settings for this 3D Scene.

environment.title: Environment
environment.notes: Settings for the 3D environment and effects.

lighting.title: Lighting
lighting.notes: Configure the global Lighting of the scene.

canping.name: Players Can Ping
canping.hint: Enable the ability to ping locations for players (default Shift+E).

canpingpan.name: Players Can Send Camera Position
canpingpan.hint: Enable the ability to send the camera position for players (default Shift+Q).

enableGameCamera.name: Enable Game Camera
enableGameCamera.hint: Enable the 'Video Game' like camera. This will be forced on for players while the GM will be able to toggle it.

gameCameraMinAngle.name: Min Angle
gameCameraMinAngle.hint: The minimum angle the camera can be rotated to.

gameCameraMaxAngle.name: Max Angle
gameCameraMaxAngle.hint: The maximum angle the camera can be rotated to.

gameCameraClipping.name: Clipping
gameCameraClipping.hint: If enabled hide objects covering the current camera target.

gameCameraDefaultGm.name: GM Default On
gameCameraDefaultGm.hint: Wheter GMs should have the Game Camera toggled on when first loading a scene.

gameCameraAutoLock.name: Auto Re-Lock
gameCameraAutoLock.hint: If the Game Camera is unlocked from it's target, automatically relock it if the target changes.

gameCameraWarnings.name: Show Warnings
gameCameraWarnings.hint: If enabled, show warning for Game Camera functionality.

configApp.title: 3D Canvas Configuration
configApp.name: Global Settings
configApp.label: Configure Global 3D Canvas Settings
configApp.hint: Configure Global 3D Canvas Settings. These settings will be applied to all clients. All other settings below this one will be client specific.

baseStyle.name: Base Style
baseStyle.hint: The base style to use: Image will display the chosen image, solid will draw a miniature style base.

solidBaseMode.name: Solid Base Mode
solidBaseMode.hint: The default solid base mode to use: Merge will not move the original model, on top will offset the model to the top of the base.

solidBaseColor.name: Solid Base Color
solidBaseColor.hint: The color of the solid base. Can be a hex value or a color name (or any CSS color). default is #1c1c1c

startMarker.name: Turn Start Marker
startMarker.hint: When in combat, place a marker where a token started the turn. Only owners of that token will be able to see it.

selectedImage.name: Selection Highlight Image
selectedImage.hint: The image to display when selecting a token.

colorizeInidcator.name: Colorize Highlight Image
colorizeInidcator.hint: Colorize the Highlight Image to match default foundry border colors.

enableReticule.name: Enable Reticule
enableReticule.hint: Enable the targeting reticule to highlight tokens the current user is targeting. This will create a reticule similar to the 2D one.

hideTarget.name: Hide Target Indicator (if solid base)
hideTarget.hint: Hide the target indicator if the token has the base enabled, the targets will be shown in the base ring highlight.

rotateIndicator.name: Rotate Base
rotateIndicator.hint: Rotate the 3D Base to match token Rotation.

templateEffects.name: Enable Template Effects
templateEffects.hint: Automatically apply shaders to templates based on damage type. Currently only dnd5e is supported.

lightHelpers.name: Enable Light Helpers
lightHelpers.hint: Enable the light helpers. This will show the light source and the area of effect of the light when in the lighting layer.

templateSyle.name: Template Style
templateSyle.hint: The style to use for the measured templates.

gridMode.name: Grid Draw Mode
gridMode.hint: How the grid is drawn. Fast is better in general but only supports square grids. Mirror, will mirror 1:1 the foundry grid but is more expensive to render.

autoPan.name: Auto Pan
autoPan.hint: Hooks the 3D Camera panning to the 2D one. Mainly, moving a token will have the camera follow it. When disabled you can always pan to the selected token with Ctrl+X

conservativeHitbox.name: Conservative Hitbox
conservativeHitbox.hint: Restrict hitbox size for tokens so that it does not overflow outside the token's base.

screenspacepanning.name: Enable Screen Space Panning
screenspacepanning.hint: Enable screen space panning for the 3D view (map controls style).

altCameraControls.name: Alternative Camera Controls
altCameraControls.hint: When enabled, Left click will not rotate the camera. Rotation will be on Middle Mouse button instead.

enabledamping.name: Enable Damping
enabledamping.hint: Enable damping for the camera. Disable this option if you experience motion sickness. (Shift+R in 3D view to reset the camera and apply this change).

camerafocuszoom.name: Enable Camera Focus Zoom
camerafocuszoom.hint: When focusin the camera on a token with Shift+X Zoom in on the token

standupFace.name: Stand-ups Face Camera
standupFace.hint: 2D Tokens displayed in a stand-up style will always face the camera.

useMultithreading.name: EXPERIMENTAL: Use Multithreading
useMultithreading.hint: Use multithreading to improve performance of Fog of War Calculations. This settings has no effect if you are not using the Fog of War.

miniCanvas.name: Enable Canvas Popout
miniCanvas.hint: Pop out the 2d canvas into a separate window when the 3D mode is activated

preventNegative.name: Prevent Negative Elevation
preventNegative.hint: Prevents token movement to go below the game board

outline.name: Outline
outline.hint: Outline canvas objects on hover and selection. Disable for better performance.

fullTransparency.name: True Transparency
fullTransparency.hint: To avoid visual artifacts, 3D Canvas uses alpha clipping to handle transparency, this can result in jagged edges. If you use very few transparent textures, or you have no overlapping transparency you can enable this setting to make transparent textures look better. Use at your own risk, may cause visual glitches.

globalCollision.name: Enable Global Collision
globalCollision.hint: Enable collision for all tokens on the board.

antialiasing.name: Anti-Aliasing
antialiasing.hint: Enable Anti-Aliasing at the cost of some performance. FXAA will have almost zero impact on performance. SMAA will give you better results but might be slightly more performance intensive.

fowQuality.name: Fog of War Quality
fowQuality.hint: Set the resolution of the Fog of War.

dofblur.name: Depth of Field
dofblur.hint: Enable Depth of Field Blur. This will blur the background when the camera is close to a token making it feel like you are at the table. Higher setting means more blur, performance is not affected by the level of blur. Can have high performance impact when enabled.

shadowQuality.name: Shadow Quality
shadowQuality.hint: The resolution of the shadows. Set to 'Disabled' to disable shadows.

enableShaders.name: Enable Shaders
enableShaders.hint: Enable shader special effects. Some of the effects can be performance intensive depending on the hardware and the amount. Disable for better performance.

enableEffects.name: Enable Effects
enableEffects.hint: Enable weather and particle effects. Some of the effects can be performance intensive depending on the hardware and the amount. Disable for better performance.

softShadows.name: Soft Shadows
softShadows.hint: Enable soft shadows at a minor cost in performance. Requires refresh.

resolution.name: Resolution
resolution.hint: The resolution of the 3D canvas, this will affect performance.

cameralockzero.name: Prevent Negative Camera
cameralockzero.hint: Prevent camera to Pivot or Pan below zero (requires refresh).

debugMode.name: Debug Mode
debugMode.hint: Show helpful debug info for troubleshooting.

macrodialog.title: Export Particle Effect
macrodialog.label: Name:
macrodialog.placeholder: Enter a name for the macro

welcome.title: Welcome to 3D Canvas
welcome.content:
Welcome to 3D!

Welcome to 3D Canvas! First, thanks for supporting my development endevour and making this project possible! Simply Click the button (Token controls, top left) to switch a scene to 3D.

Getting Started

This module, while not complicated to use has a lot of options that will give you the ability to highly customize the system. It's highly advised to read the documentation (by clicking the Getting Started button below). You can always find the documentation later in your compendiums! The documentation also has a collection of video tutorials that you can reference.

Troubleshooting

If you experience any issue or have trouble with configuration or 3d models do not esitate to reach out on the discord channel!

dialog.title: 3D Canvas: Performance Settings
dialog.content: Chose your preferred Graphic Quality (the page will be refreshed):

buttonTooltip.low: Recommended for Older Dedicated GPUs or Modern Integrated GPUs

settings.presetHint: Choose a visual quality preset to automatically set the settings below. You can always change them individually afterwards. Hover buttons for hardware recommendations.
settings.resolution: With current settings, 3D Canvas will run at a {resolution} resolution.
settings.resolutionTooltip: Using 3D Canvas at a high resolution can be very demanding on lower end hardware, especially when running above 2K resolution. If you experience performance issues, try lowering the resolution.

controlsReference.title: 3D Canvas Tile Editor Controls
controlsReference.clone: Before initiating a transform, hold CTRL to Clone
controlsReference.select: Hold F and drag to select, Left drag to release previous objects, Right drag to add to selection

config.title: Shaders Configuration
config.label: Shader Configuration
config.notes: Configure the visual effects to be used on this 3D Object.
config.slow: WARNING: Using many instances of this shader may cause performance issues.

wind.name: Wind
wind.description: Wind like effect to add some movement to your vegetation.

distortion.name: Distortion
distortion.description: Distortion effect perfect for a Lava pool or other viscous liquids.

water.name: Water
water.description: Simple, sine wave based, water effect. Effective and very cheap on performance.

oil.name: Oil
oil.description: Oil/Liquid Metal effect. The effect can be colorized and scaled, keep in mind that the color will be distorted by the effect.

ocean.name: Ocean
ocean.description: Complex water simulation that uses multiple waves. Heavier on performance than the simple water shader.

grid.name: Grid
grid.description: Project the scene grid on this 3D Object. Only square grids are supported. This shader will use the grid color and opacity set in the scene settings.

triplanar.name: Triplanar
triplanar.description: Advanced texture projection technique to correctly texture surfaces that would otherwise have stretched textures on steep angles.

textureScroll.name: Scroll
textureScroll.description: Simple texture scrolling effect similar to the 'Parallaxia' module.

fire.name: Fire
fire.description: Fire effect. The effect can be colorized and scaled to produce results that go way beyond fire.

lightning.name: Lightning
lightning.description: Lightning like effect with moving electric arcs.

ice.name: Ice
ice.description: Frosted surface effect with a very subtle animation.

idle.name: Idle
idle.description: Simple displacement effect meant to be used on tokens to give them more life.

colorwarp.name: Color
colorwarp.description: Color distortion effects, multiple can be set at the same time. Glow works best with the Bloom effect enabled in the scene configuration.

textureRotate.name: Rotate
textureRotate.description: Texture rotation effect, requires a texture and some texture repetition to work.

overlay.name: Overlay
overlay.description: Texture Overlay. Requires a texture to be set. Use 'Multiply Blending' for textures with white background, 'Black Blending' for textures with black background.

textureGradient.name: Gradient
textureGradient.description:
Texture Gradient. Requires a texture to be set. Map texture to elevation or inclination.
When using Inclination, 1 corresponds to a flat surface, 0 to a vertical surface.

sound.name: Sound
sound.description: Requires a sound to be playing. For performance only the first sound playing will be used if multiple.

dialog.title: Getting Started
dialog.content: Do you want to start the 3D Canvas Getting Started Tour?

getting-started.title: Getting Started
getting-started.description: This tour will guide you through the very basics of 3D Canvas.

step-1.title: Getting to the 3D View (2/2)
step-1.content: Click on the Cube button to Activate the 3D View.

step-2.title: Controls
step-2.content: The Loading Screen contains helpful information on the 3D Canvas Camera and Token Controls.

step-3.title: Navigation
step-3.content: The navigation bar contains various buttons to toggle specific aspects of the 3D View. You can hover over the buttons to see a description of what they do.

step-4.title: Game Camera
step-4.content: The Game Camera is enabled by default for GMs and Players. If you are a GM, you can switch to Free Camera with this button. You can change the Game Camera options in the module settings or disable it per scene.

step-5.title: Controls Reference
step-5.content: You can bring back up the controls reference any time by clicking this button.

first-tile.title: Placing your first 3D Tile
first-tile.description: This tour will get you started on placing 3D Tiles.
first-tile.requires: You need to have the 3D View active and the 3D Canvas Mapmaking Pack installed to start this tour.

step-1.title: Controls
step-1.content: Click this button any time to get a controls reference for the Tile Editor as a Chat Message (GM only).

step-3.title: Navigate to the 3D Assets
step-3.content: Follow the steps to get to the 3D Canvas Mapmaking Pack Tiles folder.

step-4.title: Navigate to the 3D Assets
step-4.content: Follow the steps to get to the 3D Canvas Mapmaking Pack Tiles folder.

step-5.title: Navigate to the 3D Assets
step-5.content: Follow the steps to get to the 3D Canvas Mapmaking Pack Tiles folder.

step-6.title: Navigate to the 3D Assets
step-6.content: Follow the steps to get to the 3D Canvas Mapmaking Pack Tiles folder.

step-7.title: Navigate to the 3D Assets
step-7.content: Follow the steps to get to the 3D Canvas Mapmaking Pack Tiles folder.

step-8.title: Drag & Drop
step-8.content: Drag & Drop a 3D Model the same way you would do with a 2D Tile. Use the Controls Reference to manipulate the Tile as you prefer. The 3D Canvas Macro Compendium includes useful macros to manipulate tiles.

scene-configuration.title: 3D Scene Configuration
scene-configuration.description: This tour will guide you through the scene configuration options.
scene-configuration.requires: You need to have the 3D View active to see this tour.

step-0.title: Head to the 3D Tab
step-0.content: The 3D Tab contains all the settings for the 3D Scene.

step-1.title: Enable for Players
step-1.content: If you don't have this setting enabled, your players will not be able to enter the 3D View.

step-2.title: Enable 3D on Load
step-2.content: With this setting enabled, thee scene will be automatically loaded in the 3D View when you activate it.

step-3.title: Sight
step-3.content: By default 3D Canvas will mirror visibility of the 2D View using it's walls (indipendently of their visible status) to calculate token vision. Enable this setting to ignore the 2D Vision and use the 3D Environment to calculate sight.

step-4.title: Fog of War
step-4.content: The fog of war is disabled by default in 3D Mode even if it's enabled in 2D. While FoW is disabled in 3D, Players will be able to see the entire environment but tokens will still be hidden based on vision. If you wish to use FoW it's strongly suggested that you have 'Shared Context' enabled in the 3D Canvas module settings.

step-5.title: Environment
step-5.content: The HDRI and the Skybox contribute to the scene lighting (think of it as global illumination). Changing the HDRI can drastically alter how a scene looks! Try to set the HDRI to some of the options included in the 3D Canvas Mapmaking Pack!

step-6.title: Skybox
step-6.content: If you are using a high quality HDRI, it's suggested to leave this field empty. Try setting the HDRI field to one of the 'Beautiful Skies' included in the Mapmaking Pack and Remove the Skybox field to see the difference.

step-7.title: Lighting
step-7.content: This section allows you to adjust the global lighting of the scene. Try messing with the basic sliders!

step-8.title: Weather
step-8.content: Here you can set a Weather/Particle Effect for the scene. Try to enable one and see how it can enhance your scene!

step-9.title: Advanced
step-9.content: The Scene Configuration offers many more options, once you are familiar with the basic settings you can click here to show all the advanced options.

mergeTiles.title: Merge Tiles
mergeTiles.content:
Merging Tiles is an irreversible action, it's suggested to make a backup of the scene before merging high amounts of tiles.
You are about to merge %count% Tiles. Selected tiles will be excluded. Are you sure you want to continue?
